commit_message:
Remove use of mysql PASSWORD function

The PASSWORD function is deprecated in MySQL 5.7
and removed in MySQL 8.0

https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/set-password.html

Change-Id: I3cf22b0c1d6fa3fa32ee6960da5615491f980a13

commit_message:
Prometheus & Grafana - Feature Gate Compatibility

This change implements Prometheus rule and Grafana dashboard
overrides outside of values.yaml via OSH feature gate functionality.

Change-Id: I1e63655f5b96fdf2381a073e575ea5b551623fad

commit_message:
disable M325

Since we don't support python2.x anymore, we don't
need to use six.text_type.

Change-Id: Id1647b55af476ab4559759a27498ede353dd10ba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/93/756993/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: - [M325] str() and unicode() cannot be used on an exception. Remove or use six.text_type().

commit_message:
Disable octavia job to unblock gate

The octavia-v2-dsvm-tls-barbican job is failing due to a
bug in Nova. [1]

This patch temporarily disables voting on the job.  We
will re-enable it once the bug has been fixed.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1901383

Change-Id: Idd52446647a41eea0f0705c3d9627f1257a9c290

commit_message:
consumers: Expose container attributes for policy checking

Change Ie84784573893934c2887814a200e7386314b4f18 modified the policies for
consumer resources to allow the creator of a container to create consumers for
it, i.e. the rule:container_project_creator and its nested checks. These
policies can only check the creator of the container, if the consumer
controller provides the container project_id and creator_id attributes to the
policy checker.

Change-Id: I0dca191c7b480d960b436b2cd7092da068df00be
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/05/674605/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_acl_tuple(self, req, **kwargs): container = self._get_container(self.container_id) d = self.get_acl_dict_for_user(req, container.container_acls) d['project_id'] = container.project.external_id d['creator_id'] = container.creator_id return 'container', d

commit_message:
Remove functional test RBAC users and roles from devstack

When building devstack with barbican there is no need for the
functional test users and roles.

This CR will add a single script for creating those users
and roles, and that script can be called upon when needed
(for example from functionaltests/run_tests.sh and
run_tests_parallel.sh)

Co-Authored-By: Jeremy Liu <liujiong@gohighsec.com>

Change-Id: If6f06acec7d8cf509c12e3ad1fd31e7f46f608ee
Closes-Bug: #1635062

added_lines: # Setup RBAC User Roles # Admin role already exists, no need to create it here. # To retrieve it, simply uncomment: # ROLE_ADMIN_ID=$(get_id openstack role show admin)
deleted_lines: # Setup RBAC User Projects and Roles PROJECT_A_ID=$(get_id openstack project create "project_a") PROJECT_B_ID=$(get_id openstack project create "project_b") ROLE_ADMIN_ID=$(get_id openstack role show admin) # # Setup RBAC Admin of Project A # USER_ID=$(get_id openstack user create \ --password "$PASSWORD" \ --email "admin_a@example.net" \ "project_a_admin") openstack role add \ --user "$USER_ID" \ --project "$PROJECT_A_ID" \ "$ROLE_ADMIN_ID" # # Setup RBAC Creator of Project A # USER_ID=$(get_id openstack user create \ --password "$PASSWORD" \ --email "creator_a@example.net" \ "project_a_creator") openstack role add \ --user "$USER_ID" \ --project "$PROJECT_A_ID" \ "$ROLE_CREATOR_ID" # Adding second creator user in project_a USER_ID=$(openstack user create \ --password "$PASSWORD" \ --email "creator2_a@example.net" \ "project_a_creator_2" -f value -c id) openstack role add \ --user "$USER_ID" \ --project "$PROJECT_A_ID" \ "$ROLE_CREATOR_ID" # # Setup RBAC Observer of Project A # USER_ID=$(get_id openstack user create \ --password "$PASSWORD" \ --email "observer_a@example.net" \ "project_a_observer") openstack role add \ --user "$USER_ID" \ --project "$PROJECT_A_ID" \ "$ROLE_OBSERVER_ID" # # Setup RBAC Auditor of Project A # USER_ID=$(get_id openstack user create \ --password "$PASSWORD" \ --email "auditor_a@example.net" \ "project_a_auditor") openstack role add \ --user "$USER_ID" \ --project "$PROJECT_A_ID" \ "$ROLE_AUDIT_ID" # # Setup RBAC Admin of Project B # USER_ID=$(get_id openstack user create \ --password "$PASSWORD" \ --email "admin_b@example.net" \ "project_b_admin") openstack role add \ --user "$USER_ID" \ --project "$PROJECT_B_ID" \ "$ROLE_ADMIN_ID" # # Setup RBAC Creator of Project B # USER_ID=$(get_id openstack user create \ --password "$PASSWORD" \ --email "creator_b@example.net" \ "project_b_creator") openstack role add \ --user "$USER_ID" \ --project "$PROJECT_B_ID" \ "$ROLE_CREATOR_ID" # # Setup RBAC Observer of Project B # USER_ID=$(get_id openstack user create \ --password "$PASSWORD" \ --email "observer_b@example.net" \ "project_b_observer") openstack role add \ --user "$USER_ID" \ --project "$PROJECT_B_ID" \ "$ROLE_OBSERVER_ID" # # Setup RBAC auditor of Project B # USER_ID=$(get_id openstack user create \ --password "$PASSWORD" \ --email "auditor_b@example.net" \ "project_b_auditor") openstack role add \ --user "$USER_ID" \ --project "$PROJECT_B_ID" \ "$ROLE_AUDIT_ID"

commit_message:
Add a /healthcheck URL

The /healthcheck URL, as provided by oslo.middleware, is very
useful for operators to setup haproxy and to do monitoring.
Such feature is already in many services like Keystone, Glance,
and others. The same type of patch has just been approved in
Neutron.

Change-Id: Iad593e899ad2d236887c37a0c46d608817eaaf8f

commit_message:
Re-enable ironic-inspector-tempest-managed-non-standalone job

The pymemcache lib was updated recently in upper-constraints to 3.4.0
and since then the ironic-inspector-tempest-managed-non-standalone job
has been broken.
There seems to be an issue between tooz memcache driver and pymemcache,
the change in upper-constraints has been reverted [1] and the failing
version blacklisted in global-requirements.
Re-enabling ironic-inspector-tempest-managed-non-standalone as it
will now pass correctly.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/760103

Change-Id: I4944860c265f9e5060c8ab276e7962a93a27da88

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-10-12 18:43:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-deployments/commit/32ffd9114829279f1a8b0f83af77e9da903b64bc', 'message': 'WIP: Add helm-chart-collator

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-10-12 18:45:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-deployments/commit/cb0b24bd2d48be40bbda3b85613cd0c9c2685af6', 'message': 'WIP: Add helm-chart-collator

Change-Id: I60aad791ea45d86daa5b4f94e0775a18c555851d
Signed-off-by: Drew Walters <andrew.walters@att.com>
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2020-10-12 19:16:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-deployments/commit/df0fdad020e6eebeb8d580245dd2dd13228a1a6e', 'message': "WIP: Add helm-chart-collator

OpenStack-Helm charts all have a dependency on helm-toolkit, a chart in
openstack-helm-infra. This dependency presents a challenge when
deploying OSH charts using the Helm Operator, as it is unable to resolve
the dependency using the hard-coded localhost address in the charts'
Chart.yaml file.

This commit introduces the second change to introduce Airship's
helm-chart-collator [0], a service that provides a Helm chart repository
within a Kubernetes cluster. When packaging charts, the
helm-chart-collator can resolve git dependencies, enabling proper OSH
chart and helm-toolkit packaging. Additionally, the Helm Operator can
deploy charts from Helm chart repositories.

NOTE: the docker-registry and helm-chart-collator functions will NOT be
included the final OpenStack composite produced by this repository.
They are solely intended for use during continuous-integration jobs.

[0] https://opendev.org/airship/images/src/branch/master/helm-chart-collator

Change-Id: I60aad791ea45d86daa5b4f94e0775a18c555851d
Signed-off-by: Drew Walters <andrew.walters@att.com>
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2020-10-12 19:31:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-deployments/commit/90e7d24f28f719c5d16a833b2efa6b05f48c26fd', 'message': "WIP: Add helm-chart-collator

"}, {'number': 21, 'created': '2020-10-15 18:29:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-deployments/commit/9f808911f133cc890bdbf795e4a3e8396ae65ff3', 'message': "Add helm-chart-collator

OpenStack-Helm charts all have a dependency on helm-toolkit, a chart in
openstack-helm-infra. This dependency presents a challenge when
deploying OSH charts using the Helm Operator, as it is unable to resolve
the dependency using the hard-coded localhost address in the charts'
Chart.yaml file.

This commit introduces the second change to introduce Airship's
helm-chart-collator [0], a service that provides a Helm chart repository
within a Kubernetes cluster. When packaging charts, the
helm-chart-collator can resolve git dependencies, enabling proper OSH
chart and helm-toolkit packaging. Additionally, the Helm Operator can
deploy charts from Helm chart repositories.

NOTE: the docker-registry and helm-chart-collator functions will NOT be
included the final OpenStack composite produced by this repository.
They are solely intended for use during continuous-integration jobs.

[0] https://opendev.org/airship/images/src/branch/master/helm-chart-collator

Change-Id: I60aad791ea45d86daa5b4f94e0775a18c555851d
Signed-off-by: Drew Walters <andrew.walters@att.com>

commit_message:
Add helm-chart-collator

OpenStack-Helm charts all have a dependency on helm-toolkit, a chart in
openstack-helm-infra. This dependency presents a challenge when
deploying OSH charts using the Helm Operator, as it is unable to resolve
the dependency using the hard-coded localhost address in the charts'
Chart.yaml file.

This commit introduces the second change to introduce Airship's
helm-chart-collator [0], a service that provides a Helm chart repository
When packaging charts, the helm-chart-collator can resolve git
dependencies, enabling proper OSH chart and helm-toolkit packaging.
Additionally, the Helm Operator can deploy charts from Helm chart
repositories.

[0] https://opendev.org/airship/images/src/branch/master/helm-chart-collator

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/758233

Change-Id: I60aad791ea45d86daa5b4f94e0775a18c555851d
Signed-off-by: Drew Walters <andrew.walters@att.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-deployments refs/changes/39/757639/37 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

OpenStack-Helm charts all have a dependency on helm-toolkit, a chart in
openstack-helm-infra. This dependency presents a challenge when
deploying OSH charts using the Helm Operator, as it is unable to resolve
the dependency using the hard-coded localhost address in the charts'
Chart.yaml file.

This commit introduces the first change to introduce Airship's
helm-chart-collator [0], a service that provides a Helm chart repository
within a Kubernetes cluster. When packaging charts, the
helm-chart-collator can resolve git dependencies, enabling proper OSH
chart and helm-toolkit packaging. Additionally, the Helm Operator can
deploy charts from Helm chart repositories. Since a helm-chart-collator
image needs to be built at testing time to use the latest OSH charts,
this commit adds a Docker registry to the Kubernetes cluster in order to
host the helm-chart-collator image during continuous-integration jobs.

NOTE: the docker-registry and helm-chart-collator functions will NOT be
included the final openstack composite produced by this repository. They
are solely intended for use during continuous-integration jobs.

 [0] https://opendev.org/airship/images/src/branch/master/helm-chart-collator

Change-Id: I9d520a86994aa95cfbf14650cadac731026578b3
Signed-off-by: Drew Walters <andrew.walters@att.com>

commit_message:
Add Docker registry

OpenStack-Helm charts all have a dependency on helm-toolkit, a chart in
openstack-helm-infra. This dependency presents a challenge when
deploying OSH charts using the Helm Operator, as it is unable to resolve
the dependency using the hard-coded localhost address in the charts'
Chart.yaml file.

This commit introduces the first change to introduce Airship's
helm-chart-collator [0], a service that provides a Helm chart repository
within a Kubernetes cluster. When packaging charts, the
helm-chart-collator can resolve git dependencies, enabling proper OSH
chart and helm-toolkit packaging. Additionally, the Helm Operator can
deploy charts from Helm chart repositories. Since a helm-chart-collator
image needs to be built at testing time to use the latest OSH charts,
this commit adds a Docker registry to the Kubernetes cluster in order to
host the helm-chart-collator image during continuous-integration jobs.

NOTE: the docker-registry and helm-chart-collator functions will NOT be
included the final openstack composite produced by this repository. They
are solely intended for use during continuous-integration jobs.

 [0] https://opendev.org/airship/images/src/branch/master/helm-chart-collator

Signed-off-by: Drew Walters <andrew.walters@att.com>
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>

commit_message:
corrects typo in cp command

The command:
cp etc/osloconfig-generator/barbican.conf /etc/
barbican/barbican.conf

Should be:
cp etc/oslo-config-generator/barbican.conf /etc/
barbican/barbican.conf

Change-Id: If35e0278f53b3efb0f1396e831325a9160b2980e
Story: #2008238
Task: #41081

commit_message:
Remove six.add_metaclass

With python 3.x, classes can use the metaclass= logic
to not require usage of the six library.

Subsequent patches will replace other six usages.

Change-Id: I5f52283b520a3d4b5a7a112afa85d668f9ec4881

commit_message:
Install osc-placement package during client package installation

This patch makes osc-placmeent package installed as a part of client
packages, because this package is required to manage resources in
placement service.

Change-Id: Ib2524cf97f97693d7d03c1bb4fb1c2bde40d3bec
(cherry picked from commit 8f758e5e4ffc9cbca2b979f730da0fa2cd461057)

"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-09-16 11:17:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/1dc906adfed6ba9389833dea9969218c2ce95456', 'message': "cinder-manage cluster remove does not work

"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2020-09-25 19:25:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/190bbe231c6309ff4554d5f43d9ba0577dd1296a', 'message': "cinder-manage cluster remove does not work

When geting the value of passed parameter 'cluster_name' from
CONF.cluster_name, the following error occurs,
oslo_config.cfg.NoSuchOptError:
no such option cluster_name in group [DEFAULT]

The root cause of the problem is that name of positional argument
registerd in CONF is 'cluster-name', which mismatch with handler method
parameter 'cluster_name'.

So we do the following processing if positional argument name contains '-',
1. put it into automatic conversion from '- to '_', so that keep the same
  name as handler method parameter, which can not contains a '-'.
2. add metavar if it doesn't already exist, and it will maintain the help
  output.

Change-Id: I3f2a04b4c8e7bafe6e38fc86a69192dd3a94c0c5
Closes-Bug: #1894381

"}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2020-09-29 15:33:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/652959e66589f4ce3e04cc8415f89948efeae6ba', 'message': "Fix cinder-manage cluster remove raising NoSuchOptError

When getting the value of passed parameter 'cluster_name' from
CONF.cluster_name, the following error occurs:
oslo_config.cfg.NoSuchOptError:no such option cluster_name in group
[DEFAULT]

The root cause of the problem is that name of positional argument
registered in CONF is 'cluster-name', which mismatch with handler method
parameter 'cluster_name'.

We fix this bug by doing the following processing if positional argument
contains '-',
1.put it into automatic conversion from '- to '_', so that keep the same
  name as handler method parameter, which can not contains a '-'.
2.add metavar if it doesn't already exist, and it will maintain the help
  output.

corresponding argument registered in CONF is 'cluster-name' actually.

positional argument contains '-':

commit_message:
Fix cinder-manage cluster remove raising NoSuchOptError

When executing 'cinder-manage cluster remove' script, an error occurs in
the call 'fetch_func_args(fn)':
oslo_config.cfg.NoSuchOptError:no such option cluster_name in group
[DEFAULT].

The cause is that the call 'fetch_func_args(fn)' is trying to fetch
value of argument 'cluster_name' of fn from CONF.cluster_name, but
corresponding argument registered in CONF is 'cluster-name' actually.

We fix this bug by changing argument name registered in CONF, if
positional argument contains '-':
1.put it into automatic conversion from '- to '_', so that keep it the
 same name as handler function argument.
2.add metavar if it doesn't already exist, and it will maintain the help
 output.

Change-Id: I3f2a04b4c8e7bafe6e38fc86a69192dd3a94c0c5
Closes-Bug: #1894381

commit_message:
types: Cleanup implementation of 'HostDomain' type

This was intended to be a variant of the 'Hostname' type yet didn't
subclass it, despite obvious advantages to doing so. Fix this now.

An unrelated change is also undone.

Change-Id: I22bcaf4e2a44c0c4b45093f18f7c89af59cce27e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

added_lines: import abc _REGEX = '(?!-)[A-Z0-9-]{1,63}(?<!-)$' def __call__(self, value): allowed = re.compile(self._REGEX, re.IGNORECASE) raise ValueError("%s is not a valid host address" % (value,))class HostDomain(Hostname): """Host domain type. Like HostAddress with added support for the '_' character, as allowed by RFC1912. .. versionadded:: 8.4 # This is the same as Hostname._REGEX with the '_' character added # # - https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1912, # - http://domainkeys.sourceforge.net/underscore.html # - https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.config/+bug/1892044 _REGEX = '(?!-)[A-Z0-9-_]{1,63}(?<!-)$'
deleted_lines: import abc HOSTNAME_REGEX = '(?!-)[A-Z0-9-]{1,63}(?<!-)$' def __call__(self, value, regex=HOSTNAME_REGEX): allowed = re.compile(regex, re.IGNORECASE) raise ValueError( "%s is not a valid host address" % (value,))class HostDomain(HostAddress): """Host Domain type. Like HostAddress with the support of _ character. :param version: defines which version should be explicitly checked (4 or 6) in case of an IP address # DOMAIN_REGEX is HOSTNAME_REGEX with the _ character added DOMAIN_REGEX = '(?!-)[A-Z0-9-_]{1,63}(?<!-)$' def __call__(self, value): """Checks if is a valid IP/hostname. If not a valid IP, makes sure it is not a mistyped IP before performing checks for it as a hostname. """ try: value = super(HostDomain, self).__call__(value) except ValueError: # Check if domain is valid # Add support of underscore # https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1912, # http://domainkeys.sourceforge.net/underscore.html # https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.config/+bug/1892044 try: value = self.hostname(value, regex=self.DOMAIN_REGEX) except ValueError: raise ValueError( "%s is not a valid host address" % (value,)) return value

added_lines: Vault Plugin ^^^^^^^^^^^^ Vault is a Hashicorp tool for securely accessing secrets and other objects, such as API keys, passwords, or certificates. Vault provides a unified interface to any secret, while providing tight access control and recording a detailed audit log. The plugin communicates with the Vault using a Vault token. The configuration for this plugin in ``/etc/barbican/barbican.conf`` is as follows: .. code-block:: ini [secretstore] .. enabled_secretstore_plugins = vault_plugin [vault_plugin] root_token_id = approle_role_id = approle_secret_id = kv_mountpoint = secret vault_url = https://127.0.0.1:8200 use_ssl = True ssl_ca_crt_file = /opt/vault/tls/tls-ca.crt

added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2020-10-27 13:36+0000\n""PO-Revision-Date: 2020-10-28 01:16+0000\n"msgid "11.0.0" msgstr "11.0.0" msgid "11.0.0-6" msgstr "11.0.0-6"msgid "" "Added two options for the PKCS#11 Crypto Plugin: `[p11_crypto_plugin]/" "token_serial_number` and `[p11_crypto_plugin]/token_label`. Both are " "optional and can be used instead of `[p11_crypto_plugin]/slot_id` to " "identify the Token to be used by the PKCS#11 plugin. When either one of the " "new options is defined the plugin will search all slots on the PKCS#11 " "device for a token that matches the given value. `token_serial_number` has " "the highest precendence and other values will be ignored when this value is " "set. If `token_serial_number` is not set, then `token_label` has the next " "highest precedence and `slot_id` will be ignored. `slot_id` will be used " "when neither one of the new options is set." msgstr "" "Added two options for the PKCS#11 Crypto Plugin: `[p11_crypto_plugin]/" "token_serial_number` and `[p11_crypto_plugin]/token_label`. Both are " "optional and can be used instead of `[p11_crypto_plugin]/slot_id` to " "identify the Token to be used by the PKCS#11 plugin. When either one of the " "new options is defined the plugin will search all slots on the PKCS#11 " "device for a token that matches the given value. `token_serial_number` has " "the highest precedence and other values will be ignored when this value is " "set. If `token_serial_number` is not set, then `token_label` has the next " "highest precedence and `slot_id` will be ignored. `slot_id` will be used " "when neither one of the new options is set."

subject: Add lock when calling idl.run()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-08-11 21:06:23.000000000', 'files': ['ovsdbapp/tests/unit/backend/test_ovs_idl.py', 'ovsdbapp/backend/ovs_idl/command.py', 'ovsdbapp/backend/ovs_idl/connection.py', 'ovsdbapp/backend/ovs_idl/__init__.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp/commit/3cf8a427c0a4dfc248e0778c3b1ee65671d1d07b', 'message': "Add lock when calling idl.run()

python-ovs transparently handles DB reconnections during calls to
Idl.run(). Since ovsdbapp uses a separate thread for the
Connection (so it can handle responding to OVSDB keep-alive echo
requests) and for processing RowEvent notifcations, it is possible
that a thread could be trying to access OVSDB data at the same
time that the Connection thread is updating it. Especially during
a reconnect where the in-memory copy of the DB will be completely
re-written, this causes a problem.

Theoretically, an application that uses ovsdbapp shouldn't access
anything in the backend code directly, but since there is now only
one supported Backend, that restriction has slipped a bit. If
all accesses were in Command objects, mostly there wouldn't be a
problem as they would be handled in the Connection thread. But
with both ReadOnlyCommands and use of lookup() and anything in
idlutils, the main thread can access the in-memory db directly and
potentially cause problems.

The most common problematic method to be called outside of Command
objects is lookup() and ReadOnlyCommands. This patch adds a lock
around calls to idl.run() and lookup() and execute() for the
ReadOnlyCommand case. row_by_value() is another target, but it is
left untouched because it doesn't have access to the API instance
and it is *mostly* called from inside Command objects. User code
that doesn't will be easy to find because user code basically
shouldn't use idlutils.

Change-Id: I98c37771883103e1fb0468de9cf85364071993fa
Closes-Bug: #1888878
"}]
commit_message:
Add lock when calling idl.run()

python-ovs transparently handles DB reconnections during calls to
Idl.run(). Since ovsdbapp uses a separate thread for the
Connection (so it can handle responding to OVSDB keep-alive echo
requests) and for processing RowEvent notifcations, it is possible
that a thread could be trying to access OVSDB data at the same
time that the Connection thread is updating it. Especially during
a reconnect where the in-memory copy of the DB will be completely
re-written, this causes a problem.

Theoretically, an application that uses ovsdbapp shouldn't access
anything in the backend code directly, but since there is now only
one supported Backend, that restriction has slipped a bit. If
all accesses were in Command objects, mostly there wouldn't be a
problem as they would be handled in the Connection thread. But
with both ReadOnlyCommands and use of lookup() and anything in
idlutils, the main thread can access the in-memory db directly and
potentially cause problems.

The most common problematic method to be called outside of Command
objects is lookup() and ReadOnlyCommands. This patch adds a lock
around calls to idl.run() and lookup() and execute() for the
ReadOnlyCommand case. row_by_value() is another target, but it is
left untouched because it doesn't have access to the API instance
and it is *mostly* called from inside Command objects. User code
that doesn't will be easy to find because user code basically
shouldn't use idlutils.

Change-Id: I98c37771883103e1fb0468de9cf85364071993fa
Closes-Bug: #1888878
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp refs/changes/46/745746/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I43b9b20fe3d3816b84405d7009484f6f5dc6ced5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-vif refs/changes/25/750925/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
"scope" conversion only just before pyroute2 method call

In "IpAddrCommand.list" method, the "scope" parameter is a string
("link", "site", "global" or "host"). This method will retrieve all
devices with an IP address calling "ip_lib.get_devices_with_ip".

Since [1], "ip_lib.get_devices_with_ip" makes the conversion of
"scope" string parameter to pyroute2 format (see
"pyroute2.netlink.rtnl.rtscopes"). The list command should skip then
the previous conversion.

Closes-Bug: #1899141

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/747406/

Change-Id: I55a0f4341b328af52ea3bd758a72f633fbe3abcb
(cherry picked from commit 0705699e6072f0862cee7749de7f7633ecc9dcfd)
(cherry picked from commit f0849bb0d2a9cbd19be7ee5312ba7e5edbc18900)
(cherry picked from commit cd0526dce8703bce12763c5c9bfc51f6d27f16c2)
(cherry picked from commit 4ef6566b6dc3d069fccf6a7b8d7a8abbadd12d35)

commit_message:
"scope" conversion only just before pyroute2 method call

In "IpAddrCommand.list" method, the "scope" parameter is a string
("link", "site", "global" or "host"). This method will retrieve all
devices with an IP address calling "ip_lib.get_devices_with_ip".

Since [1], "ip_lib.get_devices_with_ip" makes the conversion of
"scope" string parameter to pyroute2 format (see
"pyroute2.netlink.rtnl.rtscopes"). The list command should skip then
the previous conversion.

Closes-Bug: #1899141

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/747406/

Change-Id: I55a0f4341b328af52ea3bd758a72f633fbe3abcb
(cherry picked from commit 0705699e6072f0862cee7749de7f7633ecc9dcfd)

subject: WIP Allow the user to handle barbican resources if needed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-08-27 11:16:45.000000000', 'files': ['projects/70_cinder/resources.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/grenade/commit/5787cbe086a38aa9007451bb6419b89bd3492241', 'message': 'WIP Allow the user to handle barbican resources if needed

When barbican is enabled, the creation of encrypted volumes requires
users to be able to manage keys, which means adding them to the
creator roles.

Unfortunately this creates an inverse dependency with the barbican devstack
plugin, as creator is not known to a "plain" devstack.

'}]
commit_message:
WIP Allow the user to handle barbican resources if needed

When barbican is enabled, the creation of encrypted volumes requires
users to be able to manage keys, which means adding them to the
creator roles.

Unfortunately this creates an inverse dependency with the barbican devstack
plugin, as creator is not known to a "plain" devstack.
Unfortunately there does not seem to be a better way to model
this problem.

Change-Id: I114d29c09e7b0c8fe82279c6fbcbc5f50a2ef557
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/13/748413/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # WARNING: this creates an inverse dependency with the barbican devstack # plugin, as creator is not known to a "plain" devstack. # Unfortunately there does not seem to be a better way to model # this problem. # Without this change, when barbican is deployed, the newly created # cinder user has no permissions to create an encryption key. if openstack role show creator &>/dev/null; then openstack role add creator --user $id --project $project_id fi

commit_message:
Disable libvirtd.service before starting sockets

This change makes sure that libvirtd.service is stopped when starting
libvirtd-tcp/tls.socket, because these socket fails to start if
libvirtd.service is already running.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/758876/
Change-Id: I4a670aa77f0f0406a96db07877354b5067ddf1da
(cherry picked from commit 451f5203214ede6738cce5f2abeeae93a7f8ae36)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/77/758877/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # libvirtd.service should be stopped before socket service is started. # Otherwise, socket service fails to start. exec { 'stop libvirtd.service': path => ['/sbin', '/usr/sbin', '/bin', '/usr/bin'], command => 'systemctl -q stop libvirtd.service', unless => "systemctl -q is-active libvirtd-${transport_real}.socket", require => Anchor['nova::install::end'] } Exec['stop libvirtd.service'] -> Service["libvirtd-${transport_real}"] -> Service<| title == 'libvirt' |>

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: I0c20ebb46beb27640afc5258d7cabdfbda25c387
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
build: unbreak JSON serializer on failed builds

Commit 3fa5a236b4d8a31a57e14cbb482e664d5cc0111c converted status
consts into Enum. But not completely - this fix gets it done properly.

Also fixed tests.

Change-Id: Ifdacf62cd4b99c452bd09de7c6cde6fbee75560d

we need not install things from requirements.txt.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-10-12 08:44:48.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/osc-lib/commit/b58bf34e717d219a4a5fdc49e56c69a7b61a26c3', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I0833fad1c605994a774a486d15c50033ba4ae690
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osc-lib refs/changes/78/757478/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow to config network MTU

We should allow the user to config the mtu
for the namespace networks and for VIFs when
the bridge driver is used.

Change-Id: I1685e31825f15387b6486713ce007b62e915df28

commit_message:
Make memcache also listen to localhost

Currently memcache only listens to the internal_api IP. We want to
make it listen to both localhost and internal_api IP because in the
future some services on some roles may want to just use the localhost
memcached instance instead of the using multiple memcached servers
over the network as it is the case currently.

As suggested by Takashi we check the ip version in MemcachedNetwork
in order to decide if we should listen to ::1 or 127.0.0.1

Change-Id: I6ea989ae546ef344a9b3d2dd6c86a49822efc6e2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/69/758969/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - 127.0.0.1 - str_replace: template: "%{hiera('$NETWORK')}" params: $NETWORK: {get_param: [ServiceNetMap, MemcachedNetwork]} memcached::listen_ip_uri: - 127.0.0.1 - str_replace: template: "%{hiera('$NETWORK_uri')}" params: $NETWORK: {get_param: [ServiceNetMap, MemcachedNetwork]}
deleted_lines: str_replace: template: "%{hiera('$NETWORK')}" params: $NETWORK: {get_param: [ServiceNetMap, MemcachedNetwork]} memcached::listen_ip_uri: str_replace: template: "%{hiera('$NETWORK_uri')}" params: $NETWORK: {get_param: [ServiceNetMap, MemcachedNetwork]}

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-10-28 20:46:53.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_lib_charm_openstack_mysql_innodb_cluster.py', 'src/lib/charm/openstack/mysql_innodb_cluster.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-mysql-innodb-cluster/commit/14d69d24113b572e9ddb5af08c1307a522e5d934', 'message': 'Do not RESTART after configure_instance

After the mysql-shell update to 8.0.22 the shell.run_sql("RESTART") in
configure_instance began exiting with non-zero and an error message
stating the MySQL server has gone away.

It seems the shell.run_sql("RESTART") is not necessary. This change
removes this from the configure_instance method. It also adds a
restart_instance method in case we need it in the future.

Closes-Bug: #1901771
Change-Id: I5f5278a4097e75c1a37e1880b594a1e81691249b

commit_message:
Do not RESTART after configure_instance

After the mysql-shell update to 8.0.22 the shell.run_sql("RESTART") in
configure_instance began exiting with non-zero and an error message
stating the MySQL server has gone away.

It seems the shell.run_sql("RESTART") is not necessary. This change
removes this from the configure_instance method. It also adds a
restart_instance method in case we need it in the future.

Closes-Bug: #1901771
Change-Id: I5f5278a4097e75c1a37e1880b594a1e81691249b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-mysql-innodb-cluster refs/changes/34/760234/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def restart_instance(self, address): """Restart instance :param self: Self :type self: MySQLInnoDBClusterCharm instance :param address: Address of the MySQL instance to be configured :type address: str :side effect: Calls self.run_mysqlsh_script :returns: This function is called for its side effect :rtype: None """ ch_core.hookenv.log("Restarting instance: {}.".format(address), "INFO") _server_gone_away_error = "MySQL Error (2006)" _script = ( "myshell = shell.connect('{user}:{pw}@{addr}')\n" "myshell.run_sql('RESTART;')" .format( user=self.cluster_user, pw=self.cluster_password, addr=address)) try: output = self.run_mysqlsh_script(_script) except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e: # If the shell reports the server went away we expect this # when giving the RESTART command if _server_gone_away_error not in e.stderr.decode("UTF-8"): ch_core.hookenv.log( "Failed restarting instance {}: {}" .format(address, e.stderr.decode("UTF-8")), "ERROR") raise e # After configuration of the remote instance, the remote instance # restarts mysql. We need to pause here for that to complete. self.wait_until_connectable(username=self.cluster_user, password=self.cluster_password, address=address) ch_core.hookenv.log("Instance restarted {}: {}" .format(address, output.decode("UTF-8")), level="DEBUG")

commit_message:
Fix backend certificate file paths

In amphora-agent API version 1.0, backend certificate files are uploaded
to /var/lib/octavia/certs/<lb_id>/. However, the "server" line in the
rendered HAProxy configuration sets the certificate paths to
/var/lib/octavia/certs/<listener_id>/ (amphora-agent version 0.5).

This renders an invalid HAProxy configuration file and as result HAProxy
fails to reload with the new configuration, and members marked in ERROR
provisioning status.

Task: 40903
Story: 2008157

Change-Id: I7e2b12f19ee7b172464e809df6342ade1e87fb2e
(cherry picked from commit 89d5e9fcf6d456c11853e73978cb6c5530f28904)
(cherry picked from commit 3c86f1f680dc009c839897eb35b660af56c9664d)
(cherry picked from commit 539d14c577ba34de7b7bad92f549d91ce623b0b5)

added_lines: The Brocade Fibre Channel Zone Driver is being supported by the Cinder community on a best-effort basis. While it is tested with the first Release Candidate of each release, be aware that it is not continually tested by a third-party CI system. The driver was deprecated and marked as 'unsupported' in the Ussuri release, and is subject to immediate removal if the maintenance burden exceeds the community's capacity.
deleted_lines: The Brocade Fibre Channel Zone Driver is no longer supported. It is subject to removal during the "V" development cycle, following the standard OpenStack deprecation policy.

commit_message:
Do not assume that prepare_image is the last command to run

The get_deploy_steps command can be run after it breaking deploy.

Change-Id: I8e641a521a574462010a95a19e8a64ac36d4e52d
(cherry picked from commit ce46cc461d03cd89794cae0663e1d6c73fa084cd)

With the removal of Python 2.x we can remove the unittest2 compat
wrappers and switch to assertCountEqual instead of assertItemsEqual

We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: Ic21dd93b5c0fed116b772b83c052c58488606b96
'}]
commit_message:
Switch from unittest2 compat methods to Python 3.x methods

With the removal of Python 2.x we can remove the unittest2 compat
wrappers and switch to assertCountEqual instead of assertItemsEqual

We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: Ic21dd93b5c0fed116b772b83c052c58488606b96

commit_message:
Add support for system and domain scoped tokens

Currently we request to keystone via the project scoped tokens only
even if the context has system scope.
This patch converts the keystone request to system/domain/project
scoped tokens as requested in the context.

Change-Id: Ie2f124d9ef7d4d69d69bc03880644612cd338e01
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/96/752396/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if context.system_scope is not None: auth_plugin = identity.Token( auth_url=CONF.keystone_authtoken.auth_url, token=context.auth_token, system_scope=context.system_scope ) elif context.domain_id is not None: auth_plugin = identity.Token( auth_url=CONF.keystone_authtoken.auth_url, token=context.auth_token, domain_id=context.domain_id ) elif context.project_id is not None: auth_plugin = identity.Token( auth_url=CONF.keystone_authtoken.auth_url, token=context.auth_token, project_id=context.project_id ) else: # We're dealing with an unscoped token from keystone that doesn't # carry any authoritative power outside of the user simplify proving # they know their own password. This token isn't associated with any # authorization target (e.g., system, domain, or project). auth_plugin = context.get_auth_plugin()

commit_message:
[IBM DS8K]: Fixed rest API issue to get bundle

Cinder driver for IBM storage DS8K is calling the unsupported
rest API "api/v1", which is failing with R9 version. Some
how this unsupported API is working with R7 and R8 versions.

Modified IBM DS8K driver to use the supported API to get the
bundle information.

closes bug: #1895510

Change-Id: If8c17eb48b67e7b109e19e4b064260cb52b5cecf

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Force array and srp configuration

Add InvalidConfigurationValue exception when getting attributes
from cinder.conf if either the powermax_array or powermax_srp
options are not configured. This will be checked during driver
initialization, when getting volume details and when checking
U4P failover details.

Change-Id: I2add29441cf0410b32c4c7f53824d9d301018349

commit_message:
Add timeout to image operations in the direct deploy

Currently they may hang when the remote server is not responding.

Change-Id: I1de17fed3b43a3d16795dc614ce76e2cfe1faca0

added_lines: --- fixes: - | Adds timeout to HTTP image validation and downloading operations, so that the ``direct`` deploy does not hang when the remote server is not responsive. The default timeout is 60 seconds and can be changed via the new ``webserver_connection_timeout`` option.

commit_message:
Monkey patch original current_thread _active in processutils

Monkey patch the original current_thread to use the up-to-date _active
global variable. This solution is based on that documented at:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/592

Change-Id: I0a2c1e0d8a8cad99d68100d25e88e0d3a2eb8f5c
Related-Bug: #1863021
(cherry picked from commit 6533958f5fcec8b1577f56834ea2dc75a4f211e3)

commit_message:
Bump hacking min version to 3.0.1

hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to avoid bringing in a new
version with new checks.

bumping the min version for hacking so that any older hacking versions
which auto adopt the new checks are not used.

Change-Id: Ib8ef6b77b70b70a36ad186cec92ca958f967c821

commit_message:
zuul: Stop testing against Tempest

Neither Tempest itself nor any of the service projects use OSC. As such,
there's no reason to run Tempest jobs here. It's simply a waste of
resources.

Change-Id: I74b0b196fe59e5e1462e3dadc659cf6680a53f80
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove six

With python3.x, classes can use 'metaclass=' instead of
'six.add_metaclass', 'six.iteritems' and 'six.iterkeys' can
be replaced by 'items' and 'keys', 'six.moves.urllib.parse'
can be replaced by 'urllib.parse', 'six.StringIO' and
'six.moves.cStringIO' can be replaced by 'io.StringIO',
'six.text_type' and 'six.string_type' are just 'str'.

Change-Id: I9bd4886ebe05f920c4a23d0f4ffe5878aeacb92c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cliff refs/changes/88/756188/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: import six if six.PY2: def getwriter(encoding): '''Override codecs.getwriter() to prevent codec errors. The StreamWriter returned by codecs.getwriter has an unfortunate property, it will attempt to encode every object presented to it's write() function. Normally we only want unicode objects to be encoded to a byte stream. If bytes are presented (e.g. str in Python2) we make the assumption those bytes represent an already encoded text stream or they are indeed binary bytes and hence should not be encoded. When the core StreamWriter attempts to encode a str object Python will first promote the str object to a unicode object. The promotion of str to unicode requires the str bytes to be decoded. However the encoding associated with the str object is not known therefore Python applies the default-encoding which is ASCII. In the case where the str object contains utf-8 encoded non-ASCII characters a decoding error is raised. By not attempting to encode a byte stream we avoid this error. It really does not make much sense to try and encode a byte stream. First of all a byte stream should not be encoded if it's not text (e.g. binary data). If the byte stream is encoded text the only way to re-encode it is if we known it's encoding so we can decode it into a canonical form (e.g. unicode). Thus to re-encode it we encode from the canonical form (e.g. unicode) to the new binary encoding. The problem in Python2 is we never know if the bytes in a str object are text or binary data and if it's text which encoding it is, hence we should not try to apply an encoding to a str object. ''' class _StreamWriter(codecs.StreamWriter): def __init__(self, stream, errors='strict'): codecs.StreamWriter.__init__(self, stream, errors) def encode(self, msg, errors='strict'): if isinstance(msg, six.text_type): return self.encoder(msg, errors) return msg, len(msg) _StreamWriter.encoder = codecs.getencoder(encoding) _StreamWriter.encoding = encoding return _StreamWriter else: getwriter = codecs.getwriter

subject: Recover scenario settings in openstack_auth test_auth
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-09-12 23:55:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/4f98acf50f360ab1a0cce72f55ec0385c17d7aab', 'message': 'Recover scenario settings in openstack_auth test_auth

The scenario configuration in openstack_auth test_auth was ignored
somehow. Perhaps it happened when openstack_auth was merged into
the horizon repo as test runners used in the horizon repo so far
(django test runner, nose and pytest) do not support testscenarios.

This commit tries to recover the original intention of the scenario.
pytest supports several ways to parametrize tests [1]
but there seems no way without changing each test functions.
A quick port of "testscenarios" is explained [2],
but it is just a way to generate tests based on scenarios and
we still need to add scenario parameters to each test function,
so we cannot refer scenario parameters in setUp().
As a result, I chose a way to inherit the original class and
pass different attributes per scenario.
This is not ideal and I hope pytest lovers can improve the situation.

[1] https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/example/parametrize.html
[2] https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/example/parametrize.html#a-quick-port-of-testscenarios

Change-Id: I1538ffbc853a2c9328c364f462a27be36c85cc2f
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-09-12 23:58:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/b230fcd3568c370b5c45b8a5136f3b57dbfc1804', 'message': 'Recover scenario settings in openstack_auth test_auth

but it is just a way to generate tests based on scenarios and
we still need to add scenario parameters to each test function,
so we cannot refer scenario parameters in setUp().
As a result, I chose a way to inherit the original class and
pass different attributes per scenario.
This is not ideal and I hope pytest lovers can improve the situation.

The test classes in test_auth are renamed to more meaningful ones.

Direct overrides of settings in test_auth.py are improved too.

[1] https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/example/parametrize.html

commit_message:
Recover scenario settings in openstack_auth test_auth

The scenario configuration in openstack_auth test_auth was ignored
somehow. Perhaps it happened when openstack_auth was merged into
the horizon repo as test runners used in the horizon repo so far
(django test runner, nose and pytest) do not support testscenarios.

This commit tries to recover the original intention of the scenario.
pytest supports several ways to parametrize tests [1]
but there seems no way without changing each test functions.
A quick port of "testscenarios" is explained [2],
but it is just a way to generate tests based on scenarios and
we still need to add scenario parameters to each test function,
so we cannot refer scenario parameters in setUp().
As a result, I chose a way to inherit the original class and
pass different attributes per scenario.
This is not ideal and I hope pytest lovers can improve the situation.

The test classes in test_auth are renamed to more meaningful ones.

Direct overrides of settings in test_auth.py are improved too.

[1] https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/example/parametrize.html
[2] https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/example/parametrize.html#a-quick-port-of-testscenarios

Change-Id: I1538ffbc853a2c9328c364f462a27be36c85cc2f

commit_message:
[part 1] remove six.py

The Python 2.7 Support has been dropped since Ussuri.
So remove hacking rules for compatibility between python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: I807ecf358c96c1b47bd7fe63b3f5baf2ec6caac3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cliff refs/changes/32/760332/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: if six.PY2: def getwriter(encoding): '''Override codecs.getwriter() to prevent codec errors. The StreamWriter returned by codecs.getwriter has an unfortunate property, it will attempt to encode every object presented to it's write() function. Normally we only want unicode objects to be encoded to a byte stream. If bytes are presented (e.g. str in Python2) we make the assumption those bytes represent an already encoded text stream or they are indeed binary bytes and hence should not be encoded. When the core StreamWriter attempts to encode a str object Python will first promote the str object to a unicode object. The promotion of str to unicode requires the str bytes to be decoded. However the encoding associated with the str object is not known therefore Python applies the default-encoding which is ASCII. In the case where the str object contains utf-8 encoded non-ASCII characters a decoding error is raised. By not attempting to encode a byte stream we avoid this error. It really does not make much sense to try and encode a byte stream. First of all a byte stream should not be encoded if it's not text (e.g. binary data). If the byte stream is encoded text the only way to re-encode it is if we known it's encoding so we can decode it into a canonical form (e.g. unicode). Thus to re-encode it we encode from the canonical form (e.g. unicode) to the new binary encoding. The problem in Python2 is we never know if the bytes in a str object are text or binary data and if it's text which encoding it is, hence we should not try to apply an encoding to a str object. ''' class _StreamWriter(codecs.StreamWriter): def __init__(self, stream, errors='strict'): codecs.StreamWriter.__init__(self, stream, errors) def encode(self, msg, errors='strict'): if isinstance(msg, six.text_type): return self.encoder(msg, errors) return msg, len(msg) _StreamWriter.encoder = codecs.getencoder(encoding) _StreamWriter.encoding = encoding return _StreamWriter else: getwriter = codecs.getwriter

commit_message:
Delete release file for deprecated releases

The molecule tests on these release files are failing as the url
does not exists.

Adding workaround in each file is hard so cleaning it up.

Change-Id: I709d7a28f3ebd4739c3cf9cd5d5410dc7772e25b
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Expose --ansible-forks

Ansible forks are now configurable for a deployment. The default
will also no longer exceed 100 forks (but --ansible-forks can).

Conflicts:
    tripleoclient/v1/tripleo_deploy.py

Change-Id: Iaa6763a3124e45c1f0297cd59cc57f206dfc5cda
Depends-On: I57345d5b100efce143fa940b56c81f5e6bc6c390
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 896a397b1eaf0c49a5e4d15f399388a422adc939)

commit_message:
Remove upgrade_cleanup

Support for this was removed in THT several releases ago and it was only
for the initial non-containerized undercloud to containerized
undercloud.

Change-Id: I8583f795beaf0d6282cf4c836b7f597da35fb650

Stop install unnecessary packages when run tox -ereleasenotes

requirements.txt is unnecessary when run tox -e releasenotes,
releasenotes relative stuffs is in doc/requirements.txt

commit_message:
Limit monasca-persister legacy jobs to stable

monasca-persister Java implementation has been deprecated. We stop
building and publishing Java binary with Ussuri and do it only on stable
branches.

Change-Id: I9dd155227b1f4d35da8cbb09e99141758360d9ed

subject: users: Fix password error reporting on user create/update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-10-29 09:00:59.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/users/forms.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/1ef13d4fca711cf19858ad3a97ba174a2769b747', 'message': 'users: Fix password error reporting on user create/update

Fixed these:

- When changing a user password, if the password requirements had LFs in
  them, they would not be shown.

- When changing a password and the requirements were not met, the window
  was closed.

- When creating a user and the password does not meet requirements, it
  would simply say "Unable to create user." and close the window.

- When checking the logs, these errors would be not be shown.

Change-Id: I6a97b7af581c9bcb301fd7f023c203df33e44e62
Closes-Bug: #1897253
'}]
commit_message:
users: Fix password error reporting on user create/update

Fixed these:

- When changing a user password, if the password requirements had LFs in
  them, they would not be shown.

- When changing a password and the requirements were not met, the window
  was closed.

- When creating a user and the password does not meet requirements, it
  would simply say "Unable to create user." and close the window.

- When checking the logs, these errors would be not be shown.

Change-Id: I6a97b7af581c9bcb301fd7f023c203df33e44e62
Closes-Bug: #1897253

commit_message:
migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

keeping few jobs running on bionic nodeset till
https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008185 is fixed
otherwise base devstack jobs switching to Focal will block
the gate.

Change-Id: I1106c5c2b400e7db899959550eb1dc92577b319d
Story: #2007865
Task: #40188

subject: Fix permission denied during Fernet key rotation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-10-22 08:35:56.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/fix-keystone-fernet-perms-82632fb9e53ca3d5.yaml', 'ansible/roles/keystone/templates/keystone-fernet.json.j2', 'ansible/roles/keystone/templates/keystone-ssh.json.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/b45679f122b2ab083653d399144f733abbb23061', 'message': "Fix permission denied during Fernet key rotation

During a deploy, if keystone Fernet key rotation happens before the
keystone container starts, the rotation may fail with 'permission
denied'. This happens because config.json for Keystone sets the
permissions for /etc/keystone/fernet-keys.

This change fixes the issue by also setting the permissions for
/etc/keystone/fernet-keys in config.json for keystone-fernet and
keystone-ssh.

Change-Id: I561e4171d14dcaad8a2a9a36ccab84a670daa904
Closes-Bug: #1888512
"}]
commit_message:
Fix permission denied during Fernet key rotation

During a deploy, if keystone Fernet key rotation happens before the
keystone container starts, the rotation may fail with 'permission
denied'. This happens because config.json for Keystone sets the
permissions for /etc/keystone/fernet-keys.

This change fixes the issue by also setting the permissions for
/etc/keystone/fernet-keys in config.json for keystone-fernet and
keystone-ssh.

Change-Id: I561e4171d14dcaad8a2a9a36ccab84a670daa904
Closes-Bug: #1888512
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/15/759215/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use centos as base element for dib images

At the moment, it's not possible to use diskimage-builder to
create images based on centos-minimal on ubuntu focal.
To be able to use ubuntu focal as nodeset, we start using
the centos dib element.

Change-Id: Ibe363729038da92c630c4d8c4deedb2507515999

commit_message:
Remove tmp bitstream file always

On fpga program, we will download a bitstream file from glance
to a tmp local file. And no matter driver.program is success
or failed, the tmp local file should be removed

Change-Id: Ic7be96f3f6da9cf366224401bc330485e67fedf1
Signed-off-by: guolei <guolei_yewu@cmss.chinamobile.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg refs/changes/79/759579/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[OVN] Simplify connection creation logic

It's a bit cleaner to have the API classes define their own factory
methods instead of having so many if statements in get_connection().

Change-Id: I36f1f16d9eef32f4012b18685ee155cc4886e0c4

commit_message:
Check VM's console log before trying to SSH to it.

Due to issue described in related bug report, it seems that it may
happen sometimes that tempest will start trying to ssh to the instance
before ssh key will be really configured in the instance and in such
case it may happened that there will be AuthenticationFailure error
always there. Even if ssh key will be configured properly later during
the test.

To workaround that issue and avoid failures of tests, this patch adds
check if the vm is really booted and ready to ssh. It is done by
checking console log of the VM and looking for specific string "login:"
which appears at least in case of Cirros and Ubuntu images used in our
CI jobs.
In case when such string will not be found, test will continue to run
and will still try to ssh to the instance. So in worst case it may slow
ssh to the instance a bit but shouldn't really have any bad impact on
test as before this patch it would probably also wait similar amount of
time but on trying to SSH to the instance.

Change-Id: I8739f17ec8b05405056fd21f59817de60af12dd8
Related-Bug: #1892861
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin refs/changes/68/758968/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.wait_for_server_active(server['server']) self.wait_for_guest_os_ready(server['server']) def wait_for_guest_os_ready(self, server, client=None): if not CONF.compute_feature_enabled.console_output: LOG.debug('Console output not supported, cannot check if server ' '%s is ready.', server['server']['id']) return client = client or self.os_primary.servers_client def system_booted(): console_output = client.get_console_output(server['id'])['output'] for line in console_output.split('\n'): if 'login:' in line.lowercase(): return True return False try: utils.wait_until_true(system_booted, sleep=5) except utils.WaitTimeout: LOG.debug("No correct output in console of server %s found. " "Guest operating system status can't be checked.", server['id'])

Add Python3 wallaby unit tests

Ensure unit testing is in place for all the of the tested
runtimes for wallaby.

Copied from an automatically generated patch in the neutron
repo, don't know why the release bot missed it here.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

commit_message:
Get rid of service start/stop sleep

Not that the NovaServiceManager is a thing and it's a bit more smart
about starting and stopping Nova services, we can get rid of the
time.sleep() hax.

Change-Id: I840882677ed141c82cd86859c6e2a42372e90fd7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/whitebox-tempest-plugin refs/changes/08/750008/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return self.execute(self.restart_command, sudo=True) return self.execute(self.stop_command, sudo=True)
deleted_lines: result = self.execute(self.restart_command, sudo=True) # TODO(artom) We need to make sure the service has actually started # before proceeding. Otherwise, in the case of nova-compute for # example, we might go on to boot a server, only for the service to # restart in the middle of the boot process. There is no # straightforward and uniform way to wait for a service to actually be # running after a restart, so we just sleep 15 seconds. This is ugly # hax, and we need to find something better. time.sleep(15) return result result = self.execute(self.stop_command, sudo=True) time.sleep(5) return result

commit_message:
Revert updating version of pymemcache

The latest version of pymemcache (3.4.0) breaks the tooz memcache
driver effectively breaking all the projects that rely on that.
An example is provided by the ironic-inspector-tempest-managed-non-standalone
job in the ironic-inspector project where we had to force the
pymemcache version to be installed to 3.3.0
With this patch we set the version of pymemcache in upper-constraints
back to 3.3.0 and we blacklist version 3.4.0 in global-requirements
to prevent the use globally.

Change-Id: I155024516774949d9438d4f0b918f023eebcc6fc

commit_message:
Add a new parameter to enable/disable bootstrap

This change introduces a new parameter to enable/disable bootstrap
command by the keystone::bootstrap command. This parameter is useful
expecially in the deployment with multiple controller nodes, and we
can run bootstrap command on only one of the controller nodes while
we generate puppet.conf on all controller nodes, so that we can use
openstack providers in all controller nodes.

Change-Id: If049e33fefc2681d2f4340f5910402b07e6e286f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/06/758906/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | The new ``keystone::bootstrap::bootstrap`` parameter has been added, to disable ``keystone-manage bootstrap`` command. This is useful to generate ``/etc/keystone/puppet.conf`` on multiple nodes while running bootstrap command on a single node.

commit_message:
Minor fixes and improvements

Looking to eliminate FT errors

* objects:
  - drop redundant __import__
  - VnfLcmSubscription: fix typo (operationTypese -> operationTypes)
  - VnfDeploymentFlavour: set default instantiation_levels to empty list
* tacker-conductor-server:
  - fix logging error
  - fix missing vnfc resource updating on vnf respawn via SOL003-style
    Heal API call
* FT codebase:
  - VnfPackageTest: set total sizes to its real full size
  - Keystone: introduce client initialization retry
* tosca/utils:
  - fix a python3 issue
* plugins:
  - fenix: avoid an erroneous heat API call

Change-Id: I218cb0f176762d766fad5fd1f60fdfa3da628f25

commit_message:
Force CephAnsiblePlaybook to its default value on FFU prepare

There is code in tripleo-ansible [1] which will look at if user
customized the CephAnsiblePlaybook to run and, if so, will always
use that instead of the special playbook we intend to use on
_systemd or _fstobs tags.

This change will reset param value to its default on FFU
prepare so that we actually trigger the special playbooks later
on in the process, whichever custom setting operators might
have set via CephAnsiblePlaybook param for their Queens deployment.

Closes-Bug: 1898589

1. https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ansible/blob/master/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_ceph_run_ansible/tasks/main.yml#L19

Change-Id: If3c0e12181bb926125eb8aa1014db35ed111ca35

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I20e3db3b092462c85d784aad51d5e98f3499f3f1

commit_message:
New class to support keystone_auth config

The config section [keystone_auth] is used for service user, which is
different from [keystone_authtoken]. They used to be managed in the same
class, but after the deprecation in Change
I0cea57dd58b4ddc532ee28a045ec4b75b8312919, magnum can no longer fall
back to use the values in keystone_authtoken/admin_user [1]

We add a new class to manage [keystone_auth] of the config, to keep it
distinct from keystone_authtoken

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/stable/train/magnum/common/keystone.py#L122-L123

Closes-Bug: #1900813
Change-Id: Ib1fe977a151346cd2ab29ad33d7d9dbb86413fe6
(cherry picked from commit 85b20b0db469a6a0777192a7f94ea454b9d1cce8)

commit_message:
DNM: Cpu and memory live resize

support instance cpu and memory live resize,
include add nova-api, change instance xml,
resources claim and update, livirt api call.

Change-Id: I54b64a659b99da3918643c931e58c85d307041c0
Implements:  blueprint instance-live-resize
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/64/760264/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.synchronized(COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE) def live_resize_claim(self, context, instance, new_instance_type, nodename, image_meta=None, limits=None): if self.disabled(nodename): return claims.NopClaim() cn = self.compute_nodes[nodename] new_alloc = scheduler_utils.resources_from_flavor(instance, instance.new_flavor) success = self.reportclient.set_and_clear_allocations( context, cn.uuid, instance.uuid, new_alloc, instance.project_id, instance.user_id) if not success: LOG.error('Unable to replace resource claim when resize live on source ' 'host %(host)s node %(node)s for instance', {'host': instance.host, 'node': instance.node}, instance=instance) raise exception.ComputeResourcesUnavailable( reason=_('Unable to replace instance claim on source when resize live claim')) # get memory overhead required to build this instance: overhead = self.driver.estimate_instance_overhead(new_instance_type) LOG.debug("Memory overhead for %(flavor)d MB instance; %(overhead)d " "MB", {'flavor': new_instance_type.memory_mb, 'overhead': overhead['memory_mb']}) LOG.debug("CPU overhead for %(flavor)d vCPUs instance; %(overhead)d " "vCPU(s)", {'flavor': instance.flavor.vcpus, 'overhead': overhead.get('vcpus', 0)}) cn = self.compute_nodes[nodename] image_meta = image_meta or {} claim = claims.LiveResizeClaim(context, instance, nodename, new_instance_type, image_meta, self, cn, image_meta, overhead=overhead, limits=limits) # update instance numa info. old_numa_topology = claim.old_numa_topology instance.numa_topology = claim.claimed_numa_topology instance.save() # Mark the resources in-use for the resize landing on this # compute host: self._update_usage_from_live_resize(context, instance, nodename, old_numa_topology) elevated = context.elevated() self._update(elevated, cn) return claim def _update_usage_from_live_resize(self, context, instance, nodename, old_numa_topology): uuid = instance.uuid cn = self.compute_nodes[nodename] LOG.info("Updating resource usage from live resize ", instance_uuid=uuid) if old_numa_topology: old_numa_topology_dict = {"numa_topology": old_numa_topology} updated_numa_topology = hardware.get_host_numa_usage_from_instance( cn, old_numa_topology_dict, free=True) cn.numa_topology = updated_numa_topology itype = instance.new_flavor sign = 1 if itype: usage = self._get_usage_dict_resize_live( itype, instance, numa_topology=instance.numa_topology) self._update_usage(usage, nodename) def _get_usage_dict_resize_live(self, instance_type, instance, **updates): """Make a usage dict _update methods expect. Accepts an Instance and Flavor object, and a set of updates. Converts the object to a dict and applies the updates. :param instance_type: flavor as an object :param instance: nova.objects.Instance for the related operation :param updates: key-value pairs to update the passed object. Currently only considers 'numa_topology', all other keys are ignored. :returns: a dict with all the information from instance_type updated with updates """ usage = {'memory_mb': instance_type.memory_mb - instance.flavor.memory_mb, 'vcpus': instance_type.vcpus - instance.flavor.vcpus, 'numa_topology': instance.numa_topology} for key in ('numa_topology',): if key in updates: usage[key] = updates[key] return usage @utils.synchronized(COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE) def drop_live_resize_claim(self, context, instance, nodename, instance_type, old_numa_topology): numa_topology = instance.numa_topology usage = self._get_usage_dict_resize_live( instance_type, instance, numa_topology=numa_topology) # if self.pci_tracker: # pci_devices = instance.pci_devices # if pci_devices: # for pci_device in pci_devices: # self.pci_tracker.free_device(pci_device, instance) # # dev_pools_obj = self.pci_tracker.stats.to_device_pools_obj() # self.compute_nodes[nodename].pci_device_pools = dev_pools_obj self._update_usage(usage, nodename, sign=-1) if old_numa_topology: old_numa_topology_dict = {"numa_topology": old_numa_topology} updated_numa_topology = hardware.get_host_numa_usage_from_instance( self.compute_nodes[nodename], old_numa_topology_dict, free=True) self.compute_nodes[nodename].numa_topology = updated_numa_topology ctxt = context.elevated() self._update(ctxt, self.compute_nodes[nodename]) instance.numa_topology = old_numa_topology instance.save() self.reportclient.update_instance_allocation(context, self.compute_nodes[nodename], instance, -1)

commit_message:
Bump hacking min version to 3.0.1

hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to avoid bringing in a new
version with new checks.

bumping the min version for hacking so that any older hacking versions
which auto adopt the new checks are not used.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/728335/
Change-Id: I795fee73e8d44ebd7c9db205579e921c24b9055b

commit_message:
Support spicehtml5proxy on baremetal with haproxy

This patch changes the listener address for spicehtml5proxy from 0.0.0.0
(default) to the nova_management_address to avoid "Address already in use"
errors.

Change-Id: I952998f3c6dd7db218b572c057149352c41c1d65
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/68/759068/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: html5proxy_host = {% if nova_management_address == 'localhost' %}127.0.0.1{% else %}{{ nova_management_address }}{% endif %}

commit_message:
Switch to osh-deployments deploy-workload script

Since openstack-helm-deployments-test job does not deploy ingress yet,
airshipctl script is currently not compatible with it.

Also this commit mekes openstack-helm-deployments-test voting.

Change-Id: Ic6c15f7ea7d016db1920f2f780921f51fb838b89
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-deployments refs/changes/57/759757/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

'}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2020-10-07 20:16:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-deployments/commit/59bf69bdc4ae949e01d15b58ed842c24b8dd86c3', 'message': 'Add memcached function and OSH composite

This change adds a memcached function that deploys the OpenStack-Helm
memcached chart [0] and adds the function to a new composite named
OpenStack-Helm. The OpenStack-Helm composite will serve as a releasable collection
of documents that enables operators to deploy OpenStack-Helm using
Kustomize [1] and the Helm Operator [2]. Additionally, the
OpenStack-Helm composite can be used as a Kustomize entrypoint for
Airship, enabling operators to deploy OpenStack-Helm using airshipctl
[3].

This change adds the OpenStack-Helm composite to the target cluster
workload phase in order to validate the composite using the existing
airshipctl testing infrastructure.

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra
[1] https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/kustomize
[2] https://github.com/fluxcd/helm-operator
[3] https://opendev.org/airship/airshipctl

Change-Id: I571f8c85028199f4fce3613a03b4812d97906bc9
Signed-off-by: Drew Walters <andrew.walters@att.com>

memcached chart [0] and adds the function to a new composite named
OpenStack. The OpenStack composite will serve as a releasable collection
of documents that enables operators to deploy OpenStack-Helm using

OpenStack-Helm composite can be used as a Kustomize entrypoint for
Airship, enabling operators to deploy OpenStack-Helm using airshipctl
[3].

This change adds the OpenStack composite to the target cluster workload
phase in order to validate the composite using the existing airshipctl
testing infrastructure.

commit_message:
Add memcached function and OpenStack composite

This change adds a memcached function that deploys the OpenStack-Helm
memcached chart [0] and adds the function to a new composite named
OpenStack. The OpenStack composite will serve as a releasable collection
of documents that enables operators to deploy OpenStack-Helm using
Kustomize [1] and the Helm Operator [2]. Additionally, the
OpenStack-Helm composite can be used as a Kustomize entrypoint for
Airship, enabling operators to deploy OpenStack-Helm using airshipctl
[3].

This change adds the OpenStack composite to the target cluster workload
phase in order to validate the composite using the existing airshipctl
testing infrastructure.

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra
[1] https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/kustomize
[2] https://github.com/fluxcd/helm-operator
[3] https://opendev.org/airship/airshipctl

Change-Id: I571f8c85028199f4fce3613a03b4812d97906bc9
Signed-off-by: Drew Walters <andrew.walters@att.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-deployments refs/changes/01/756401/66 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- apiVersion: "helm.fluxcd.io/v1" kind: HelmRelease metadata: name: memcached spec: wait: true timeout: 600 values: monitoring: prometheus: enabled: true labels: server: node_selector_key: node-type node_selector_value: controlplane prometheus_memcached_exporter: node_selector_key: node-type node_selector_value: controlplane chart: git: https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra path: memcached ref: master

commit_message:
Allow manual setting of Ironic API Version

Typically, the Ironic API client in IPA will autodetect the API version
based on the output of a GET of the root of the API. If for some reason
this API endpoint is restricted, or the operator wishes to limit the
Ironic API version IPA uses, they can now set CONF.ironic_api_version to
avoid autodetection and force a version.

Change-Id: Ib96a1057792f45f2e4554671e32c436140463ee8

Will fall back to " "auto-detection") return self._ironic_api_version

update lower-constraints.txt

We also need to change the lower-constraint requirements to make them
py3.8 compatible. See https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1886298

commit_message:
Be explicit about the coordination URL

"localhost" can also point to ::1, but the memcached service is only
listening on 127.0.0.1, so be explicit about that in the URL that
we give to tooz.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/759831
Change-Id: I2a2ec20b7645034a23337380005add2e953f9185

commit_message:
add vnic type vdpa

This change extends the portbindings api extention
definition to add a new vnic typew "vdpa" to model
a vhost-vdpa simiar to the exisign vhost-user and
virtio-forwarder vnic types.

Change-Id: I01083fb8192b2ef00934af619576889b881c1249
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/43/760043/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # - vdpa: The vHost-vdpa transport is a new vHost backend type introduced # in qemu 5.1. vHost-vdpa leverages the vdpa framework introduced in # kernel 5.7 to implement a vhost offload of a standard virtio-net # interface to a software or hardware backend. VNIC_VHOST_VDPA = 'vdpa' VNIC_DIRECT_PHYSICAL, VNIC_VIRTIO_FORWARDER, VNIC_SMARTNIC, VNIC_VHOST_VDPA]

commit_message:
Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is deprecated and TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is
the new environment variable name that replaces it [1].

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: Ic0d2dcf20f7929733deb10a275e5d67f9627428f

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found by updated hacking version.

Update local hacking checks for new flake8, remove
test B314 since that tests difference between Python 2 and 3,
there's no need to advise using six anymore.
Use oslotest.base directly, this fixes the hacking tests.

Remove ddt usage in testsuite, it does not work with current hacking
version anymore.

Change-Id: Iee4584c6fde08728c017468d9de1db73f2c79d8d

commit_message:
Add Python3 wallaby unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for wallaby.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I8f8fbffec2aeeb649e74b3269da7d7f08f157575

commit_message:
cleanup: refactor into galera_mariadb_service_name

We had two variable names which were duplicated for the service
name, this converges them all to "mariadb" which uses the actual
systemd unit instead of the init.d compatiblity layer.

Resolved conflicts in vars/redhat-7.yml and vars/suse.yml during
cherry-pick.

Change-Id: I5805fb11a5118c4011701377cd30b2511edca505

commit_message:
Make neutron-grenade jobs to be non-voting temporary

Our gate is currently broken due to bug [1] so lets temporary
disable our grenade jobs to unblock the gate.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1901384

Change-Id: Ic0a6d1d8c04be696dc4dc0c0f3c19af0e71b3e16
Related-Bug: #1901384
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/58/759758/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Move content provider plays to a seperate playbook

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/752419 added the content
provider for centos-7 in multinode-standalone-pre.yml and
the playbook become little messy.

In order to keep thing seperate, we are moving the content
provider plays to a seperate playbook and calling the same
in multinode-standalone-pre.yml to avoid distruption in
existing workflow.

Change-Id: I3f8ae8b380b44db49e7a0486efba29d66437bd08
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/93/759793/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add capability to delete a backup archive

This patchset adds the capability to delete any archives that are stored
in the local file system or archives that are stored on the remote RGW
data store.

Change-Id: I68cade39e677f895e06ec8f2204f55ff913ce327

-eq 0 ]]; then echo "Could not access the archive: ${RESULT}" return 1 else echo $RESULT | grep "HTTP 503" if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then echo "RGW service is unavailable. ${RESULT}" # In this case, the RGW may be temporarily down. # Return slightly different error code so the calling code can retry return 2 else echo $RESULT | grep "ConnectionError" if [[ $?
